proposalPage.verifyInfo: Download votes from chain and verify the results in browser. [Read more](https://github.com/orbs-network/ton-vote#how-can-you-verify-the-results)
proposalPage.notEnoughVotingPower: Oops, it seems you don't have any voting power on block {{value}}

daoPage.endedAndDidntPassedQuorum: Proposal ended and did not pass the minimum required quorum

createDao.gettingStartedBody: TON.vote is a completely decentralized on-chain DAO governance platform built exclusively for the TON ecosystem. /n Setting up a space for a DAO is free but requires submitting 2 transactions: /n 1. Space Metadata (DAO name, description, logo, socials) /n 2. Space Administrators (space owner and proposal publisher) /n Every transaction deploys a smart contract on TON blockchain mainnet. Both transactions cost about 1 TON in gas fees. /n Any future changes to one of the above will require submitting an update transaction. /n Need help? Join the TON.vote Telegram [support channel](https://t.me/TONVoteSupportGroup).
createDao.editWarning: Edits will require to sign a transaction in your wallet
createDao.formInfo: Enter all fields in English. Future versions will support adding translations in multiple languages. You can update these fields later.

tooltips.daoName: Short name of the DAO, normally 1-4 words Capitalized separated by spaces.
tooltips.daoAbout: What is the purpose of this DAO? Normally 1-4 sentences. Formatted as Markdown
tooltips.logoURL: HTTPS URL holding the DAO's logo as a circular PNG image sized 512x512 pixels with transparent background.
tooltips.tonDNS: If you own a [TON DNS](https://dns.ton.org/) domain name, enter it to prove the space's authenticity. For example: foundation.ton
tooltips.jetton: Does the DAO revolve around a fungible Jetton token that all members hold? If so, place the TON contract address of the Jetton master contract.
tooltips.nft: Does the DAO revolve around an NFT that all all members hold? If so, place the TON contract address of the NFT master contract.
tooltips.owner: The owner of the space, can change metadata and update admins. Can be a multi-sig contract.
tooltips.proposalPublisher: The address that can publish new proposals for vote. Can be a multi-sig contract or a multi-owner contract.

errors.logoURL2: Logo URL must be png or jpg format
errors.telegram: Telegram group should start with https://t.me

common.checkWallet: Please check wallet for pending transaction

createProposal.subTitle: Enter all fields in English. Future versions will support adding translations in multiple languages.
createProposal.title: Title
createProposal.votingPeriodInfo: All timestamps are given in UTC (GMT+0). The UTC time 15:00 is a good choice for when most of the world is awake.

tooltips.title: Title of the new proposal, normally 1 sentence. Example: Increase staking reward percentage
tooltips.description: All background information needed to help members make a decision in this vote. Normally 3-10 sentences. Formatted as Markdown
tooltips.votingPowerStrategy: How is the voting power of each member counted when calculating the vote result. [Read more about strategies](https://github.com/orbs-network/ton-vote/tree/main#supported-strategies)
tooltips.votingChoices: The different options each voting member needs to choose from when submitting their vote.
tooltips.startTime: The UTC time when the vote goes live and members can start submitting their votes. Must be in the future.
tooltips.endTime: The UTC time when the vote terminates and members would no longer be able to submit votes. Must be after start time but no more than 10 days after.
tooltips.snapshotTime: To protect against manipulation, every member's voting power will be calculated on this snapshot UTC date. Must be before vote start time but no more than 14 days before.

errors.titleLength: Title must be less than or equal to {{value}} characters
errors.aboutLength: About must be less than or equal to {{value}} characters
errors.startTime1: Proposal start time must be greater than current time
errors.startTime2: Proposal start time can be up to 10 days in the future
errors.endTime1: Proposal end time must be greater than proposal start time
errors.endTime2: Proposal end time must be at least 1 day after proposal start time
errors.endTime3: Proposal end time can be up to 10 days after proposal start time
errors.snapshotTime1: Snaphot time must be smaller than current time
